You guys are encouraged to bring your own games.

events.name: Mobile Millionaire Club Mini-Gaming Event
events.description:
Do you own a mobile smartphone? YES 
Do you play mobile phone app games? YES 
We are starting a small gaming event to share a couple of new mobile games in the market. A small competition may be held within the participants. 
- tablets for gaming (subject to availability) 
- TV screen for mini gaming contest (subject to availability) 
- airconditioned environment with drinking water 
Note that this is not a sales event. 
Please send enquiries to hanryoangel@gmail.com

events.name: Docker Open-Source-a-thon
events.description: The Docker Project, the open platform for distributed applications, is organizing an open-source-a-thon. The Docker Project, the open platform for distributed applications, announced it will be organizing an open-source-a-thon where Docker core team members will teach and mentor people in how to contribute to open source. Contributions include code, documentation, tutorials, videos, and mentoring. Each contribution to the Docker Project will also support the Oceanic Society and its mission to conserve oceans. https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/9TUPu8HhBrr7DIDpX1o96dkM3SpW0py7zmVwq6PpCFw807kV-huO0IOA4gCN3rnUf7ldUT8nG89c7xn8dUPkRczicz2Ep597ydj4BSfRabK3Z2J_oaIXUJ0JLeoY9Dsp_COhDxc The program is timed to coincide with the project’s 2nd birthday and is focused on a cause – ocean and marine life health – that is important to its millions of users. Docker’s logo, Moby Dock, is a blue whale that was contributed and selected by its community. The charitable program starts on March 23 and will span a total of five weeks; part of the proceeds will go towards the adoption and naming of a female blue whale soon to be known as “Molly Dock.” Contributions from the “opening week” of the program and follow-on contributions over the subsequent four weeks will be calculated and the final donation will be made. One contribution equates to a $50 donation, and an additional $50 will be added to the “Molly Dock fund” for those that wish to continue to contribute. As we get closer to the event, more information will be added to docker.party ! Agenda: 3:00 - Doors Open 3:15 to 3:45 - Introduction & Presentation on contributing to the Docker Open Source project 3:45 to 7:30 - Break out into groups. 1) Non code contributions 2) Beginner Code contributions (either new to Go or Docker) 3) Advanced Code contributions (advanced users are encouraged to mentor #2 as well) 7:30 to 8:00 Snacks and socializing Sponsors
events.location: Viki, Block 59 Mohamed Sultan Road #04-08/09/10, Singapore 238999

events.name: Quad racing & drone fun meetup
events.description: Great park with a couple of trees (for racing & shade), concrete tables / seats, and easy to get to & find! This will be a good meetup for: • 250 Class FPV Quads - racing / chase / general mayhem • Photo/video drones (e.g. Bebop, Phantom) - nice park to get some good views, and some live action of the racing quads! • Nano / micro drones (e.g. Hubsan Q4, X4) - Wind permitting this is a fun place to fly the more powerful nano & micro quads. • Prospective quad builders / owners who want to check the sport out and get advice on what/how to build/buy to get started Hope to see you there!
events.location: Margaret Drive Park by Queensway, Margaret Close, Singapore

events.name: Meteor Meetup with Arunoda Susiripala
events.description: Hello everyone, We are group of people who think MeteorJS is awesome. We love it and embrace it very much. We are very fortunate to have Arunoda Surisipala from the Meteorhacks in town. Arunoda is a very prominent developer in the Meteor community and runs the Meteorhacks site as well as Kadira and numerous other projects. He is Singapore only for a few days but has kindly agreed to make time to meet our Meteor Singapore group. Meteorhacks website: https://meteorhacks.com/ Kadira: https://kadira.io/ Arunoda on Github: https://github.com/arunoda Hurry and RSVP. ==================================== Meetup Agenda - Just some ideas: 1. Introduction from Arunoda 2. Meteor Show and Tell. If you are working on any Meteor projects then now is a great time to share with the group. 3. Networking and maybe go for dinner/drinks somewhere... ==================================== Organizers: Tze Ken Lee, Cofounder & Director at InnoMonster Pte. Ltd. 5 years of experience in web development. Max Li Bin, Front-end Developer, 5 years of experience in web development. Ahmed Muzammil Jamal, Senior Software Engineer, BPM Consultant @ Bank Julius Baer, Experienced web designer & developer. Rick Behl: Old school programmer trying to learn new tricks... Venue Sponsor: HackerspaceSG 344B King George’s Avenue, Singapore 208576
